output.conclusion: By completing this course, you've gained a foundational understanding of digital art principles and tools. Continue practicing and exploring to develop your unique artistic style!
output.introduction: Welcome to the exciting world of digital art! This course will guide you through the basics, equipping you with the skills to create your own digital masterpieces.

chapters.description: What is digital art? Exploring the different types of digital art and the tools used. Brief history and evolution of digital art.
Overview of popular digital art software (e.g., Krita, Procreate, Adobe Photoshop). Interface and basic functionalities.
Choosing the right hardware (tablets, stylus). Configuring your software for optimal performance. Creating a comfortable workspace.
Introduction to fundamental art principles: line, shape, color, value, texture, space, and form.
Understanding the color wheel. Primary, secondary, and tertiary colors. Color harmonies and color schemes.
What are layers and why are they important? How to create, organize, and manage layers in digital art software.
Exploring different brush types and their uses. Experimenting with brush size, opacity, and flow.
Using basic shapes to build complex objects. Understanding perspective and creating depth.
Introduction to shading and highlights. Using value to create form and dimension. Basic rendering techniques.
